messages.title: RE-ELECT A SCOTTISH GOVERNMENT WORKING FOR SCOTLAND
messages.content: In government the SNP has delivered 84 of our 94 headline pledges.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: £300 in your pocket, that's the average family saving from our council tax freeze.
1,000 more police on the streets, driving crime down to a 32-year low.
Jobs protected with massive cuts in small business rates.

mentions.tacticalSituation: You have two votes for Scotland's election in May.

quotes.text: In 2007 the first SNP government in Scotland's history was elected with the support of Scots from all walks of life. We have delivered 84 of our 94 headline manifesto commitments. And we look to the next four years determined to do more. With your support again this May, we can keep the 1,000 extra police on our streets. We can freeze the Council Tax for another two years. And we can protect NHS budgets ensuring healthcare continues to improve. Our pledge is to be a Scottish government that works hard for the people of our nation. With your support we can build on the work of the past four years. Progress has been made and there is more to do. Together, we can make Scotland better.

images.caption: Image of Alex Salmond with the text SNP WORKING FOR SCOTLAND
